Bracknell Forest – Consultation on library cuts.
Bury – Consultation on library cuts: some closures may occur.
Suffolk – Debenham Library moves into larger space at primary school.

Telford and Wrekin – Dawley, Donnington, Hadley, Madeley, Newport and Stirchley will stay open: Newport and Madeley will continue to be run by the council, the four others will be run by town/parish councils. Opening hour cuts and other changes will occur: consultation.
York – Library service officially receives charitable status. £97k grant from Arts Council England.
Cheshire West and Chester – Mobile library consultation.
Stockton – £130k cut, including £77k from closing Fairfield.
Haringey – Muswell Hill Library may relocate: consultation.
Blaenau Gwent – Ebbw Vale Library refurbished.
Worcestershire – Upton Upon Severn Library building transferred to community trust: service itself stays with council.
Dorset – 3 out of 4 mobile libraries to be withdrawn.
Leeds – Burley Library closed February 2016 (source: email from council)
Greenwich – Mobile library service to be withdrawn, £126k cut.
Darlington – Confirmed Cockerton and Crown Street Libraries will close. 25 library staff to lose posts.
North Somerset – Congresbury and Worle libraries under threat.
Central Bedfordshire – £85k cut: total loss of 35 hours opening per week.

Herefordshire – Comparative budget per year: 2010/11 £2.8m, 2011/12 £2m, 2012/13 £1.6m, 2013/14 £1.6m, 2014/15 £1.7m. Cuts expected of £60k 2016.17, £100k 2017.18, £90k 2018/19 (source; FOI request seen)
